author: Deepa H
text:
Lack of permission for quarrying blue metal and earth is slowing down progress of National Highways projects, including widening of Dindigul-Theni, Krishnagiri–Tindivanam and Madurai-Ramanathapuram highways. “Since we are pressuring contractors to finish up, they say they are getting the material from other sources. They ask us to talk to the State government to get permission,” said V. Chinna Reddy, Chief General Manager (Technical), National Highways Authority of India.

Dindigul-Theni project was being carried out at a cost of Rs. 331 crore. The 182-km-long Krishnagiri-Tindivanam project was being carried out at a cost of Rs. 624 crore. Widening of Madurai- Ramanathapuram project, at a cost of Rs. 1,387 crore, too was progressing slowly. Recently, Union Minister for Road Transport and Shipping Nitin Gadkari wrote to Chief Minister Jayalalithaa, urging her to look into issues pertaining to land acquisition, forest clearances and quarry permissions.

List of affected projects in the State has been furnished to the government
title: “Road projects hit by lack of permission for quarrying”
